column4: Hello community. I recompiled my kernel 4 times now, and its never able to mount my root fs, which is reiserfs. The splashscreen comes up but everything stops at "Mounting root filesystem \n Waiting for root fs". Can unsupported hardware cause this? I compiled reiserfs support in the kernel offcourse
then, you have sata support problem
but it worked when I had ext3 root fs
you can boot livecd to fsck
but, wait, its working with the default kernel, im here now
btw, are you sure it's the correct kernel you are booting?
but I am wondering, when I download the kernel sources, and do a menuconfig, is the default settings the same as the settings in the default kernel package?
no, you have to go over menuconfig
ok, thanks for your help, Ill dive in to the menuconfig once again
if you can still change, reiserfs is not a good choice, try jfs/ext3, or xfs, if you have UPS
yes, I actually think ill do that
